headline: freezing rain warning in effect
description:
Ice build-up due to freezing rain is expected or occurring.

Freezing rain along with ice pellets and snow is expected. Note that a snowfall warning is also in effect for the region.

What:
Threat of a few hours of freezing rain.
Icy and slippery conditions.
 
When:
Freezing rain beginning late this afternoon or evening and ending early Saturday morning.

Additional information:
Snow is expected to move into the region during the day, but may become mixed with ice pellets as the day progresses. The threat of several hours of freezing rain tonight is possible.

Note that for areas closer to Montreal River, more of the precipitation is expected to fall in the form of snow. Refer to the snowfall warning that is in effect for more information.

After a brief break during the day Saturday, another winter storm will likely affect the region on Sunday with a threat of significant snowfall, freezing rain and ice pellets. More details on precipitation amounts will come in future updates.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Utility outages may occur.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
instruction: Slow down driving in slippery conditions. Watch for taillights ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
